intro: Rebutia stuemeriana, commonly known as the Stuemer's euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and thick, fleshy stems. The plant features small, spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive crown of bracts. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its stems and leaves. Rebutia stuemeriana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
